wikipedia_page.main: Albert Edward Handcock, 5th Baron Castlemaine (26 March 1863 – 6 July 1937), styled The Honourable from 1869 to 1892, was an Irish peer. He was a major landowner with 12,000 acres (49 km2).

response: |Albert Handcock, 5th Baron Castlemaine||7 March 1898||Eyre Massey, 4th Baron Clarina||6 July 1937

Gairdner was born in Batavia, Netherlands East Indies (now Jakarta, Indonesia) on 20 March 1898. Brought up in County Galway, Ireland, he was educated at Repton School in England, and the Royal Military Academy, Woolwich. He married the Hon. Evelyn Constance Handcock, daughter of Albert Handcock, 5th Baron Castlemaine, in 1925.Statesmen & Scholars And other fascinating Western Australians: A Tour Guide for the Karrakatta Cemetery Historical Walk Trail 1 , Metropolitan Cemeteries Board (WA).
| Moydrum Castle || Athlone || County Westmeath || Albert Handcock, 5th Baron Castlemaine || 3 July 1921 a.m.|| Abandoned as ruins

After the ambush the British carried out an intensive search for the IRA men.  The Black and Tans knew that most IRA members in the area were farmers and so focussed on farmhouses.  In the early hours of 2 July a group of masked men in "trench coats and tweed caps" burnt five farmhouses in Coosan district and one at Mount Temple, in apparent retaliation for the death of Lambert.  The following day the IRA, in turn, burnt down Moydrum Castle, the home of Albert Handcock, 5th Baron Castlemaine.
